title: Alternativity
summary: In abstract algebra, alternativity is a property of a binary operation.  A magma G is said to be .mw-parser-output .vanchor>:target~.vanchor-text{background-color:#b1d2ff}left alternative if ( x x ) y = x ( x y ) {\displaystyle (xx)y=x(xy)} for all x , y ∈ G {\displaystyle x,y\in G} and right alternative if y ( x x ) = ( y x ) x {\displaystyle y(xx)=(yx)x} for all x , y ∈ G . {\displaystyle x,y\in G.} A magma that is both left and right alternative is said to be alternative (flexible).[1]
